reviews.review_msg: Completely useless lecturer.  Cannot communicate, and tries to encourage interest by saying "who wants an A".  Do not take his class.  Should not be teaching

Horrible class, disorganized and no direction or guidelines for any projects, doesn't reply to email and gives no helpful responses to students, it's almost like she doesn't want anyone to learn anything valuable and wants to be insufferable. I would have taken this with any other professor if I had the chance.

The course itself is really straightforward. However, her expectation on a two page report is beyond ridiculous. She doesn't clarify what contents she want and she is super picky about the grammar. She is marking harder than an English course!!! Very unreasonable.

Great professor, but considering it was a 400 class, his participation marks will kill your grade if you aren't there 95% of the time. But he's a great guy with a sense of humor. Class is interactive full of discussions to make you think and apply the discussed material. I learned a lot in Carlos' class!

Prof Carlos cares a lot about his students, and would do anything to accommodate and help anyone. I thought his lectures were super dry though, but it couldve better in person - what a shame I had to do it online. Exams were pretty easy and group project is fair so the curve was very competitive. I still recommend taking it with him though!

I was never bored in this class, and learned so much. He tells stories to help you remember concepts, lets you out early if he completes everything earlier than planned. I didn't miss class and studied a lot, but never felt he was unfair. Lots of reading. The project isn't bad.

His class is alot of course work and readings, but he is passionate and knowledgeable about the topics he teaches. Most importantly he is passionate about seeing his students succeed. He is a great professor and I would recommend to take him. He is also hilarious, which for a 3 hr lecture is MANDATORY.

Very smart guy and teaches you concepts that your typical Finance prof wouldn't teach. Tough exams, but the averages are typically lower for the course. Overall, if your interested about finance and economics this course is great.

A little quiet, so sit up front. He rambles because he is clearly very knowledgeable. I thought the exams were fair, literally had questions from the practice on it (same numbers too). I read the textbook but the slides and attending lectures was enough to do well imo. A straightforward course and decent prof, would recommend.

Nice professor, very knowledgeable, and smart. Attend his office hours and he will be patient to answer your questions. Exam may test you something that beyond textbook, but that what we should prepare for the 4-level course.

Worst professor I have ever had, which says a lot given that I have encountered some bad ones. You can't hear a word he says, and he makes no effort to engage the class. He gives mini quizzes every class to make sure you attend because he knows no one would show up otherwise. His exams test the most obscure facts that are so minute and unimportant.

One of the most boring, difficult profs I've ever encountered. His lectures are extremely boring, and he emphasizes no content. Everything from the big concepts to the tiniest minutia is taught with the same importance. Every lecture has a novel's worth of written content. His slides have a comically large amount of content, most is irrelevant.

Midterm was worth 40% and final 50%, the other 10% were based on random quizzes and assignments. Nobody can really hear him in lectures. He is a tough grader, some material in exams were not taught in lecture and depends on an individuals financial background knowledge. Does not give out formula sheets for exams. DO NOT RECOMMEND HIM!!

Patrick is a great prof! He is one person who teaches important stuff related to the course with in depth knowledge of the way the industry works. He communicates information as if he is a friend of yours and not a teacher and he is always available for extra help after class. He gives great feedback and encourages the class to ask questions

I had the pleasure of having Patrick as my professor this semester. He really cares about his students and does a great job at teaching material that will help once you leave school and begin working. He isn't an academic and this is hugely important in finance - it made for an interesting and practical learning experience. I enjoyed his class!

410 has been one of great classes. learn so much from lecture, he also from industry, so he has real world story and experience. and even group project is tough it is very fair. definitely recommended.
I really enjoyed the course.  Great teacher although very demanding course.  Two essays, three quizzes.  A very international perspective.  Great lectures and interesting reading materials.

Patrick is a boss in real life. He is nice and enthusiastic. His 410 is fairly easy except he gives a lot of work: 3 quizzes, 2 papers, 3 writing assignments, 1 presentation (but no final). He is an easy marker and gives good grades. If you don't mind having lots of work, you should choose him for 410.
Always smiling. Encouraging. Enthusiastic.   Wonderful Professor.

One of the best teacher I've ever had at sfu. He was very helpful, he has the experience in really life business and you will learn a lot from him. quiz are more than fair if you read your slide. we did not have a final and the he graded assignment paper and report very fairly. I will recommend this teacher 100%

Patrick is a very nice guy. I have taken numerous Finance courses and the information learned in this class is the most valuable for me. He does not give outlines for reports which is great because you can focus on what you think is most importan. In fact, the reports I completed in this are the best reports I've ever been asked to do.
